title: Bok Choy Stir-Fried with garlic
summary: Bok Choy Stir-Fried with garlic might be just the side dish you are searching for. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegan recipe has 173 calories, 0g of protein, and 14g of fat per serving. For 15 cents per serving, this recipe covers 1% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 15 minutes. If you have vegetable oil, salt, ginger, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 8%. This score is improvable. Try Bok Choy, Shiitake, and Garlic Noodles, Garlic Ginger Zucchini Noodle Bowl with Salmon and Bok Choy, and Stir-Fried Baby Bok Choy with Garlic for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Trim away and discard the bottom inch or so at the base of the bok choy, along with any tired outer leaves and stalks. Quarter the bok choy lengthwise and then line up the spears. Cut crosswise into 2-inch lengths and transfer the pieces to a large bowl. Tumble to loosen up all the leaves and pieces; you should have around 6 cups.                                                    Heat a wok or a large deep skillet over high heat. Add the oil and swirl to coat the pan.                                                    Add the ginger garlic, and salt and toss well. Scatter in the bok choy and toss well until it is shiny and beginning to wilt less than 1 minute.                                                    Add the sugar and water and continue cooking, tossing now and then, until the leaves are vivid green and the stalks are tender but not limp. 1 to 2 minutes. Add a little more water if needed to prevent burning while cooking.                                                    Transfer to a serving plate and serve hot or warm.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Trim away and discard the bottom inch or so at the base of the bok choy, along with any tired outer leaves and stalks. Quarter the bok choy lengthwise and then line up the spears.
Cut crosswise into 2-inch lengths and transfer the pieces to a large bowl. Tumble to loosen up all the leaves and pieces; you should have around 6 cups.
Heat a wok or a large deep skillet over high heat.
Add the oil and swirl to coat the pan.
Add the ginger garlic, and salt and toss well. Scatter in the bok choy and toss well until it is shiny and beginning to wilt less than 1 minute.
Add the sugar and water and continue cooking, tossing now and then, until the leaves are vivid green and the stalks are tender but not limp. 1 to 2 minutes.
Add a little more water if needed to prevent burning while cooking.
Transfer to a serving plate and serve hot or warm.
